html:
this people did not exist. The Chaldeans were Semitic nomads who came to be known as Babylonians. They inhabited the wilderness areas of the Fertile Crescent where Babylon was built. They had little significance (did not exist) among the earth's nations until the Assyrians came and built cities and fortifications ("founded it") in their land, thus making the city of Babylon powerful.

set up the towers. The Assyrian army set up siege towers as they surrounded Tyre.

they stripped its palaces. The Assyrians stripped Sidon's palaces of their ornaments, wealth, and leaders; they even pulled down Tyre's walls.

he brought it to a ruin. The subject here is the Lord, who brought about Tyre's harsh and swift ruin through Assyria (25:2).
